output.conclusion: This course has provided an in-depth exploration of advanced heat transfer concepts. By mastering these principles, you are well-equipped to tackle complex thermal engineering challenges and contribute to innovative solutions in various industries.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Heat Transfer! This course delves into the intricacies of heat transfer phenomena, building upon fundamental principles to explore advanced topics relevant to expert-level engineers and researchers. We will cover conduction, convection, and radiation in detail, with a focus on analytical and numerical techniques for solving complex heat transfer problems.

chapters.description: Explore multi-dimensional conduction, transient heat transfer in complex geometries, and the use of Green's functions. Analyze heat transfer in anisotropic materials and composite structures.
Implement finite element and finite difference methods for solving conduction problems. Focus on meshing techniques, boundary condition implementation, and convergence criteria.
Investigate heat transfer phenomena at the micro and nanoscale, including ballistic transport, size effects, and applications in microelectronics and nanotechnology.
Delve into turbulent flow heat transfer, including Reynolds-averaged Navier-Stokes (RANS) models, large eddy simulation (LES), and direct numerical simulation (DNS).

Examine the fundamentals of boiling and condensation heat transfer, including nucleate boiling, film boiling, dropwise condensation, and film condensation. Analyze heat transfer enhancement techniques.
Study natural convection in enclosures and external flows, including stability analysis, boundary layer theory, and applications in electronic cooling and solar energy.
Explore radiative properties of surfaces and participating media. Analyze view factor calculations, radiative exchange in enclosures, and the discrete ordinates method (DOM).
Investigate problems involving simultaneous conduction, convection, and radiation. Focus on solution techniques and applications in combustion, furnaces, and solar collectors.
Study non-equilibrium radiation phenomena, including laser-material interactions, short-pulse laser heating, and applications in materials processing and biomedical engineering.
